reviews.review: It's a nice movie, just because adults don't like it doesn't mean is not good for children which is what the movie is intended towards. The
The Holocaust was more entertaining than this TBH
It was way better than the reviews made it out to be. Kind of dragged out in the end but the jokes made me chuckle and my 3 year old enjoyed it.
This is an intriguing documentary about emojis, that features the creatures in their natural habitat: The smart phone. I rate this film 11 poop jokes out of 10 minutes.??
This movie was amazing for me and my kids! I was always laughing and I just loved all the cool emojis. Definitely will watch this movie again.

The only redeemable thing about this pile of ?? is the animation, which still isn't that great. I will say that the world of emojis is barely creative. However, the adventure and the worlds they come across are not at all.

After a couple of minutes that seemed to last a lifetime, I went out to the car and waited for everyone else, who all joined me shortly.  The Emoji Movie is soul-crushing horrible.  I wish memories could be removed like the cancerous Tumor this movie reminds me of.

this movie was among the worst things i have ever experienced in my life. it is like being dipped in nuclear waste while on painkillers. you feel agony, then nothing, and then the agony of having your skin peeled off, and then you're dead. nothing of who you were remains. this movie is like a badly made sandwich. it has the formula/order for one but the components are made out of horse shit. the dialog was worse than that of a babbling toddler. the story is not boring, for it is revoltingly insulting to the budget this movie has somehow been trusted with. seriously, the worst part has to be the budget. it is incredibly close to that of the lego movie which made $450,000 in box offices. maybe you didnt like the lego movie but it had much more dimension and appreciation than most do and its a movie about legos. the emoji movie is an attempt to create art but ending up pissing on the lawn. as for redeeming features, this movie did have well colors and somewhat creative ideas for copyrighted media. they also had some (one) truly cinematic moment. unfortunately, a movie based on trends cannot last any longer than the trend does. and that trend is already over. the characters are like stale milk, lacking depth and development. the composition, transitions, gimmicks, everything is like eating human meat. its meat, but it gives you the shakes and you know what it is. there has even been an attempt at social justice but they did it terribly, making the statement look bad. this has been the embarrassment. the unforgivable. the disgrace to the thousands of years of fine arts. the hidden tenth layer of hell. i beg of you, dont watch it.
